column4: Hello evry1, I've got samba nstalled. Im trying to follow a step by step guide but there is something wrong here: Once I start the Samba Server Configuration, I get warning message stating that it couldn't understand some of the lines at smb.conf. Nevertheless I can add the (ubuntu) shared folder. When I go to Nautilius to see the folder's properties its NOT shared, and if I go back to open...
...Samba Server Configuration, I get warning again and the shared folder is NOT listed. Any and all ideas are appreciated. TIA!
What application gives you that error ?
GAdmin-SAMBA is installed I just dont know where iuts at :/

I used GADMIN-SAMBA, added the shares, added the 2 pCs, but again, when I go back to nautilus, the folder is NOT shared. Also, none of the PCs see the other one. Do I have to restart my ubuntu machine? TIA
also, the information line in GADMIN-SAMBA says: "Status: Activated, inactive servers: nmbd"
The name server, NMBD must be running in order for the other computers to query and see it or for it to assemble browselists. Try to start NMBD manually "sudo su" "nmbd -D"
See to it that the server settings are as your network looks like "ifconfig"
sudo su nmbd -D returned 'D' as an invalid option
is "nmbd" the same as server host name?
No, thats just a command to start the nmbd server
It can exit without telling why because the allowed hosts and networks etc ipaddresses are wrongly configured.
is there any way i could reset everything?
remove samba conf, restart the program.
Should not be required but there are thousands of settings so maybe that can help.
